DOC.brief_summary: Pallidal stimulation is effective in patients with generalised idiopathic dystonia. The aim of this study is to: 1. evaluate the efficacy and safety of this treatment in patients with idiopathic generalised dystonia, 3 years after surgery and 2. assess the recurrence of the motor symptoms after the switch off.
DOC.brief_title: Pallidal Stimulation in Patients With Idiopathic Generalised Dystonia
DOC.criteria: Idiopathic generalised dystonia Pallidal stimulation Minimental status (MMS) < 24 Severe psychiatric disorder
